paper_abstract: We present a new dynamic programming algorithm that solves the minimum Steiner tree problem on graphs with k terminals in time O* (c(k])) for any c > 2. This improves the running time of the previously fastest parameterized algorithm by Dreyfus-Wagner [1] of order O* (3(k)) and the so-called "full set dynamic programming" algorithm [2] solving rectilinear instances in time O* (2.3 8(k)).
paper_title: Dynamic programming for minimum steiner trees
